panel.title: Everything in its Right Place
panel.intro:
California Closets, the industry leader in custom closet and home storage design, came to us in 2008 with one very large question: what did they have to do to make their online lead acquisition efforts work better? Not an easy question to answer—especially when you're talking about a company with 90+ franchises, each running their own programs through their own unique websites, contracting to all different SEM vendors around the country.

We knew there was a lot we could do here, and we knew that the job couldn't be done by picking and choosing the channels to optimize. The only answer was a holistic, comprehensive search solution: integrated search.
panel.supplemental: % increase in lead volume/ % decrease in cost per lead

nodes.node: Overview

California Closets' challenges online were multifarious. With 90+ franchises running their own programs through their own SEM vendors, on their own URLs, the brand strength in the search engines was totally diluted. The corporate website, fully Flash-based and entirely non-compliant with SEO standards, failed to attract strong organic rankings, and prevented successful lead captures through PPC. The franchises all promoting themselves independently created massive search engine overlap and internal PPC competition. The program was losing money, and to fix it they needed a big, comprehensive solution.
Objectives
Restructure the entire company-wide SEM program around a single corporate website and SEM vendor
Build a site designed to attract organic rankings and convert PPC visitors to leads
Build a reporting solution to analyze all data on multiple business levels
Track all leads individually, including both online leads and phone calls
Increase lead volume through PPC advertising
Decrease cost per lead through PPC
Increase organic traffic and lead volume
Improve on-site lead conversion rate
Tactics
Built a new, SEO-friendly site with customizable sections for each franchise and landing pages for each product/service
Consolidated the company-wide web presence around the new site
Consolidated the company-wide SEM programs around one vendor (ISM)
Built a custom reporting dashboard accessible by both corporate and franchise employees
Implemented call-tracking technology
Rebuilt the PPC program from the ground up, with all franchises now acting in harmony
Optimized all Google Local listings
Implemented strategy for landing page testing and optimization
Results
Grew lead volume 112% in first three months
Decreased cost per lead 63% in three months
115% increase in total visitors from April to August
Traffic and lead volume growth continues month over month

panel.title: Selling Indie through AdWords
panel.intro: When they came to us, Insound.com already had a loyal following in the indie music space. Founded in 1998, Insound is one of the leading retailers of all things indie, from LPs to T-shirts, posters, books, and even quirky niche electronics. But they were looking to expand their customer base through Google AdWords; they'd been running their own program for over a year, with no success whatsoever. So in early 2007, they hired iSearch Media to turn that situation around.
panel.supplemental:
“ISM's expertise in PPC advertising is, at least in my experience, completely unrivaled.”
-Patrick McNamara, Managing Director, Insound

nodes.node: Overview

Insound offers a range of products focused around the indie music space, including music (LPs, CDs, and MP3s), apparel, posters, and electronics. Insound hired iSearch Media to design a PPC program to increase its online sales volume, with a particular emphasis on high-margin items such as turntables. This included building and deploying a comprehensive keyword set, testing relevant messages, identifying growth opportunities, optimizing lead acquisition costs, and determining what strategies would result in the highest-value paid search sales.
Objectives
Increase revenue from PPC sales
Improve PPC profitability (ROAS)
Determine which keywords drive higher-value sales
Determine which messaging generates the most profitable sales activity
Increase visibility of the Insound brand
Tactics
Built PPC campaigns mirroring the structure of Insound's full product line across the U.S., the Americas (non-U.S.), Europe, and Asia
Designed ROAS-focused bid strategy tailored to each vertical and market
Established long-term strategy for ongoing messaging testing and optimization
Implemented aggressive branding strategy through bids and messaging
Results
Increased monthly revenue by 60% since start of relationship
Increased profitability (ROAS) by 50% since start of relationship
Grew brand sales from negligible levels to over 30% of total revenue

panel.title: B2B SEO Simplified
panel.intro:
“Meeting Scheduling Simplified” - that's what NetSimplicity is known for. They sell B2B products designed to help their clients schedule and coordinate the use of their office meeting and conference rooms, to prevent double-booking with the use of intuitive in-house software. If only acquiring new customers were that simple...

NetSimplicity came to ISM in the spring of 2008, and tasked us with helping them reach aggressive client acquisition goals for the upcoming quarter. They've been a great client ever since, and we've worked for them in a number of capacities, including PPC management, LPO, and lead quality optimization. Some of the most striking resutls we've driven, though, came from search engine optimization.
panel.supplemental: Increase in conversions by improved keyword-to-target page relevancy

nodes.node: Overview

NetSimplicity’s Meeting Room Manager (MRM) software simplifies everyday administrative tasks for more than 2,500 customers in leading corporations, educational institutions, law firms, healthcare facilities, and nonprofits worldwide. NetSimplicity engaged with iSearch Media to improve upon an SEO initiative that had plateaued for the previous six months. This included auditing their current SEO vendor, understanding where the opportunities for growth lay, and deploying strategies that would result in higher volumes of organically driven leads.
Objectives
Audit current SEO strategy to find new opportunities
Implement SEO strategy for new site launch
Drive increased volumes of quality leads
Tactics
Built an SEO keyword strategy targeting high-converting PPC keywords
Built a website transition strategy to prevent a drop in lead flow; moved old site over to new
Built and implemented an external link strategy focused on an organic growth cycle
Developed a multi-channel social media strategy to help engage users and drive quality links
Results
Transitioned from old site to new site successfully without lead loss
Improved monthly lead volume by 59% since the start of the relationship
Increased on-page conversion rate by 117% by improving keyword-to-target page relevancy

panel.title: Teaching a Site to Convert
panel.intro:
GlobalEnglish provides online language learning and support for over 450 companies who operate internationally, from HP to Deloitte to IBM. They hired ISM at first to manage their pay-per-click campaigns; in addition, we recommended a landing page optimization plan to enhance the returns on the PPC investment.

The results? Read and learn.
panel.supplemental: Conversion rate improvement after landing page optimization

nodes.node: Overview

GlobalEnglish offers online English instruction to large and medium sized companies who need a scalable solution to improve the business English capabilities of their workforce.

GlobalEnglish engaged with ISM to develop an LPO initiative that would improve the performance of its paid search landing pages, with a particular emphasis on click-to-lead conversion rate. This included analyzing their existing landing pages, formulating testable hypotheses, working with their design team to generate a new page, and conducting the landing page test.
Objectives
Increase conversion rate on target landing page
As a result, improve PPC lead volume & profitability (CPA)
Enable greater visibility & more aggressive spend in PPC advertising
Tactics
Clarify and simplify the landing page’s message
Incorporate a targeted call-to-action
Increase the visual prominence of the lead form (the intended action) on the landing page
Change the on-page images to create a more user-friendly feel
Rewrite and reformat the copy to emphasize top selling points; reduce wordiness
Results
Six-fold increase in conversion rate: from 0.50% to over 3.0%
Drastically improved PPC effectiveness; lead volume increased five-fold, CPA reduced by 400%
Efficiency improvement has allowed for much more aggressive PPC bidding at the same budget, resulting in greater brand visibility across the entire account
